Award.AwardTitle: Student Travel Grants for Symposium On Usable Privacy and Security 2015

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration: Usable security and privacy is increasingly recognized as an important aspect of the cybersecurity field. The Symposium On Usable Privacy and Security (SOUPS) brings together an interdisciplinary group of researchers and practitioners in human computer interaction, security, and privacy. The program features technical papers, workshops and tutorials, a poster session, panels and invited talks, and discussion sessions. The eleventh SOUPS will be held July 22-24, 2015 in Ottawa, Canada. The funds support travel grants for students to attend the conference. SOUPS is the top conference devoted to usable privacy and security. By increasing student participation at the SOUPS conference, it may encourage more students to get involved in usable security research and pursue further graduate education and careers in this area.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goal of the Symposium On Usable Privacy and Security (SOUPS) is to bring together an interdisciplinary group of researchers and practitioners in human computer interaction, security, and privacy to present and discuss cutting edge research. The eleventh SOUPS was held July 22-24, 2015 at Carleton University in Ottawa, Canada. The program featured technical papers, workshops and tutorials, a poster session, panels, invited talks, and lightning talk and demo sessions. SOUPS is a unique, interdisciplinary conference that focuses on an important and strategic aspect of computer security and privacy that is often overlooked by traditional security researchers. The conference has played an important role as a catalyst that has helped foster interdisciplinary collaborations and encouraged more researchers to enter this field. In 2015, SOUPS was attended by over 178 people from around the world. There were 22 papers and 30 posters presented in the main conference. The SOUPS 2015 workshops were: Workshop on Inclusive Privacy and Security (WIPS): Privacy and Security for Everyone, Anytime, Anywhere, Workshop on Usable Security and Privacy Education, and 2nd Annual Privacy Personas and Segmentation (PPS) Workshop. There was also a tutorial on Examining Cybercrime through multiple lenses.

 All papers are available from the conference website http://cups.cs.cmu.edu/soups/2015/
